'''''SEVEN 14''''' is the fourteenth volume of the [[Marion E. Wade Center]]'s annual journal ''[[SEVEN]]'', published in [[1997]].<ref name="jstor" />
==Contents==
*"Dorothy L. Sayers and the Oecumenical Penguin"
**By: Giles Watson
*"Dorothy L. Sayers and Aristotle"
**By: Rosamond Kent Sprague
*"Beyond Ideas: The Intrigue of the ''Lilith'' Manuscripts"
**By: Rolland Hein
*"Response to Dorothy L. Sayers's ''Worship in the Anglican Church''"
**By: John Thurmer
*"Disseminating Glory: Echoes of Charles Williams in the Works of T.S. Eliot"
**By: Suzanne Bray
*"Warren Lewis: Historian of the Inklings and of Seventeenth-Century France"
**By: [[Richard C. West]]
*"On Being a Ghost"
**By: Jill Paton Walsh
*"Christmas and Sport"
**By: G.K. Chesterton (Introduction by Adam Schwartz)
*"Authors on the Internet"
**By: Anthony Palmer Dawson<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/article_index|articlename=Contents By Volume|website=[https://journals.wheaton.edu/index.php/vii/index VII: Journal of the Marion E. Wade Center]|accessed=13 August 2025}}</ref>
